etymology.description: Origin unknown; probably an ancient variant of 元/天/堯; historically used interchangeably with 無 and readopted by the PRC in 1956; not to be confused with 旡.
etymology.interpretation: Meaning 'not/without' was shared with 無 in early texts, and the simpler graph 无 was revived and standardized in the PRC. Its graphic ancestry is uncertain—possibly linked to 元, 天, or 堯—so it is best viewed as an old variant rather than a regular semantic–phonetic formation.
etymology.simplification: Adopted a historical variant with fewer strokes (无) to replace 無 in 1956; variant-based stroke reduction rather than structural simplification.

examples.chinese: 我无话可说(我無話可說)。
他毫无经验(他毫無經驗)。
examples.english: He has no experience at all.
